TopicTitle: Sometimes unable to Recover Vessel or go to Space Center post-flight

Articles.Content:
KSP Version: 1.12.0.3140; Windows x64 on Steam

After spacecraft touches back down on Kerbin and stops moving, I am sometimes unable to recover the vessel, go to the space center, or quick-save; clicking on the proper buttons does nothing, forcing me to revert the flight or watch as seemingly nothing happens.

 

Screenshot of the craft in the water, with the Recover Vessel/Space Center buttons showing up and not grayed out, as if I'm allowed to use them.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1i9ZTxeA6bKjkbpb78subw3exxSiu4b-u/view?usp=sharing

 

In a previous session, I had the same issue where my command pod was on a slight hill near the water, and was trying to figure out if there was a way to force the recovery. After a while, I noticed the pod seemed to be slowly sliding down the hill, and thought maybe the slight movement was preventing recovery, but I don't know for sure.

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1WkAyTro1rzjBIf-IJaN8dWmz2V3mluXJ/view?usp=sharing

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1sk-Hu-rZHg9uPqkFRWT6wuwMExbEWxFC/view?usp=sharing

 

Here's the player.log for the craft in the water;

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1zdY-grtTKaBVf1JJ7HqDt4zg47t3Iyq7/view?usp=sharing

And the player-prev.log for the craft on a slight hill;

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1c4iRQhLJojf6pC7LuEk3sWldcMYHdsRz/view?usp=sharing

 

PC Specs 

Spoiler

CPU: AMD 3400g

GPU: NVIDIA GTX 1650 Super

RAM: Crucial Ballistix 3600 2x8GB

MOBO: ASRock B550M Pro4

Storage:
 - Boot drive: 500 GB SSD
 - Installation Drive: 5400 RPM 3TB HDD

Game has no mods, and to my knowledge has not been updated after its installation. Both game sessions are from today, June 27th 2021.

This has happened to me after touchdown on Kerbal and after walking on the Mun and planting a flag.

I also noticed that my point of view seems by default to be below the surface and I can see through either Kerbal or the Mun into space (I can actually see Kerbal from the far side of the Mun).

Edited June 28, 2021 by Ed B

I have this exact same issue with the same error message however it has only started happening on recent flights. It seems that a craft that has landed on the Mun which decouples another controllable part i.e a rover results in this bug.  The only fix I've found is to make sure I don't decouple anything while landed on the Mun.

My son and I find ourselves in the same situation as the OP. 

After playing a bit and upgrading my mission control and tracking station to level 2 each, it hasn't occurred for me since. 

Noteworthy... Neither of us are very advanced. We're not doing mun missions or anything that complex yet.

I thought maybe putting the science parts on the side of my command pod may have caused the issue, though adding a service bay and putting them in there instead didn't fix it.

 

On 6/28/2021 at 12:44 PM, Quixxilver said:

My son and I find ourselves in the same situation as the OP. 

After playing a bit and upgrading my mission control and tracking station to level 2 each, it hasn't occurred for me since. 

Noteworthy... Neither of us are very advanced. We're not doing mun missions or anything that complex yet. 

I got around to upgrading just my mission control and haven't noticed it ever since then either, though I've also upgraded my tracking station by this point. I'm always able to recover my crafts while directly controlling them when I should be able to, it's not like I need to back out to the tracking station to recover them from there; it just magically started working like it should.

Computers/programs are just weird sometimes, I guess
